meanings.def: a human, especially one who is not identified
examples: A certain person (= somebody that I do not wish to name) told me about it.
The price is $40 per person.
This vehicle is licensed to carry 4 persons. (= in a notice)
(law) The verdict was murder by a person or persons unknown.
The virus is spread from person to person.

meanings.def: a person working in the area of business mentioned; a person connected with the thing mentioned
examples: a salesperson
a spokesperson

meanings.def: any of the three classes of personal pronouns. The first person (I/we) refers to the person(s) speaking; the second person (you) refers to the person(s) spoken to; the third person (he/she/it/they) refers to the person(s) or thing(s) spoken about.
if you have or carry something about/on your person, you carry it about with you, for example in your pocket
examples: Relatives of the dead man were traced through an address found on his person.

meanings.def: to treat everyone in the same way, without being influenced by their importance, wealth, etc.
examples: Death is no respecter of persons.

meanings.def: if you do something in person, you go somewhere and do it yourself, instead of doing it by letter, asking somebody else to do it, etc.
examples: He had to pick up his welfare cheque in person.
She appeared in person to collect her prize.

meanings.def: in the form or shape of somebody
examples: Help arrived in the person of his mother.
The firm has an important asset in the person of the sales director.

meanings.def: a person who is believed to be involved in a crime, but who has not been arrested
examples: Police have said they do have a person of interest in the case.
